name: reparable
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
that can be changed and made better, or repaired: The faults of the system are for the most part reparable. A person may suffer a reparable brain hemorrhage from a mild bump on the head.
More examplesFewer examplesA vote of no confidence would not be reparable. Old glassfibre boats are just about infinitely reparable.Currently, nerve cells are neither reparable nor replaceable.Protein carbonylation is an irreversible and not reparable reaction.
